title: Governors Island National Monument: Park Home
body: A Silent Sentinel in New York Harbor  From 1794 to 1966, the U.S. Army on Governors Island was part of the social, political, and economic tapestry of New York City. Today, the island is a vibrant summer seasonal venue of art, culture, and performance against the backdrop of two centuries of military heritage and the skyline of one of the great cities of the world. The island is now open for the summer until September 25, 2016. Read More               Mandarin Chinese Talks   您会说中文吗？您想了解更多关于总督岛国家纪念古迹威廉姆斯城堡（Castle Williams）的历史吗？         New App!
